comments.content:
Agreed. 

A: A rainbow table is a precomputed table for reversing cryptographic hash functions, usually for cracking password hashes. The passwords in this attack are plain text, not hashes so a rainbow table is not being used.
B: The attack in this question is against a web server while the server is online. Therefore, this is an online attack, not an offline attack so this answer is incorrect.
C: The attack in this question is against a web server while the server is online. Therefore, this is an online attack, not an offline attack so this answer is incorrect.

So D is in fact the answer

offline was merely used to throwing test takers off line...brute force attack is what the answer is..running different combination of words trying to guess which one matches the password is brute force..forget about the offline distraction

discussion.content: This is an online attack. So only two choices are A and D. Rainbow table is the use of hashes, while hybrid is a combination of dictionary and brute force. So, this is letter D.

D sure 
https://comptiaexamtest.com/Security+SY0-401/tag/online-hybrid-attack/

a little more research shows ROE is the correct answer.

correct answer is rule of engagement
ROE, are meant to list out the specifics of the penetration testing project to ensure that both the client and the engineers working on a project know exactly what is being testing, when its being tested, and how its being tested
I agree as well. Definitely ROE

questions.question_text: A company that is hiring a penetration tester wants to exclude social engineering from the list of authorized activities. Which of the following documents should include these details?

discussion.content:
None of the answers are right in my opinion. The last column Primarykey should not exist because it was not defined in the CREATE TABLE statement. The last element in the statement, PRIMARY KEY ID, is setting the ID column as the primary key and not creating a Primarykey column. The last column to be created is the Description column.

As for the answer being C, I would argue that C and D both contain the same data and the same data types. The only difference between C and D is the width of the Type column. However, the CREATE TABLE statement fails to specify a width which leads me to believe that either C or D would be the answer minus the Primarykey column. I also would not have specified TEXT data types. Instead, I would have specified VARCHAR data types.

comments.content: Completely and utterly agree with this.
Agree as someone mentioned above the options might be clearer on the actual exam.

discussion.content: they don't have the same data. The columns are diff widths

comments.content: probably C and D doesn't have the same contents in the exam

discussion.content: I don't get it, why would the response be "C" when "D" has the same data
what's the difference between C and D O.o ?

questions.question_text: A security analyst is reviewing output from a CVE-based vulnerability scanner. Before conducting the scan, the analyst was careful to select only Windows-based servers in a specific datacenter. The scan revealed that the datacenter includes 27 machines running Windows 2003 Server Edition (Win2003SE). In 2015, there were 36 new vulnerabilities discovered in the Win2003SE environment. Which of the following statements are MOST likely applicable? (Choose two.)

choices.E: Remediation of all Win2003SE machines requires changes to configuration settings and compensating controls to be made through Microsoft Security Center's Win2003SE Advanced Configuration Toolkit.
choices.B: Microsoft's published schedule for updates and patches for Win2003SE have continued uninterrupted.
choices.A: Remediation is likely to require some form of compensating control.
choices.D: The resulting report on the vulnerability scan should include some reference that the scan of the datacenter included 27 Win2003SE machines that should be scheduled for replacement and deactivation.
choices.C: Third-party vendors have addressed all of the necessary updates and patches required by Win2003SE.

discussion.content: yes, A & D (who's marking these? Can't they read? TWO answers!)
A & D?

comments.content: Win2003SE (2015 EOS)- while waiting for decom and since no more security updates will be applied or available as it is already EOS a compensating control is required

discussion.content: why not D and E ?
A and D?
Answer should be netstat

comments.content: netstat monitors traffic not blocks it

questions.question_text: A company's asset management software has been discovering a weekly increase in non-standard software installed on end users' machines with duplicate license keys. The security analyst wants to know if any of this software is listening on any non-standard ports, such as 6667. Which of the following tools should the analyst recommend to block any command and control traffic?
